page.title: 13EVIDENCE FROM THE PAST
page.content: {Hensbarrow Downs }at the East of the region are the highest moorlands in the area.Because of their prominence a Beacon formed part of the warning system of the previous centuries.If enemies approached from land or sea, a man on watch would light a fire as warning. There are {ancient barrows }on the Downs, communal burial chambers of prehistoric man.Many of these ancient sites are in danger of disappearing forever beneath the china clay waste tips. There are approximately 100 {Norman {Fonts }in Cornwall, and a very fine example may be seen at Roche Church. {'The Snail's Creep' }was a {dance } performed by the villagers of Roche until early tis century.Dancers followed the band in ever-decreasing circle and then turned to unravel it.
